snippet: A jury found that a Guatemalan immigrant set a blaze in an illegally subdivided apartment building with few exits.
abstract: Daniel Ignacio, Guatemalan immigrant from Brooklyn, is convicted of murder, arson and assault for starting a fire in crowded tenement  in 2010 that killed five other Guatemalan immigrants in one of deadliest New York City blazes in years.
lead_paragraph: A jury found that a Guatemalan immigrant set a blaze in an illegally subdivided apartment building with few exits.

headline.seo: Guatemalan Immigrant Found Guilty in Deadly Brooklyn Tenement Fire
headline.main: Jury Finds Tenant Guilty of Setting Deadly Fire at a Crowded Brooklyn Tenement in 2010
headline.print_headline: Jury Finds Tenant Guilty of Setting Deadly Fire at a Crowded Brooklyn Tenement in 2010
